list_definition.definition: having the form of a circle
leading back to the point from which it started
a notice etc, especially advertising something, sent to a number of persons

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We often get circulars advertising holidays.

list_ex_of_english: Informal circulars of this kind are settled departmentally and do not require individual approval by myself.
They have issued a number of circulars on the subject.
Since then, the following seven circulars related to reorganisation of local government have been issued.
To emphasise this, circulars will in future state that they may be freely reproduced by all those to whom they are addressed.
Circulars, statutory orders and regulations which concern the curriculum responsibilities of head teachers and school governing bodies are sent direct to all schools.
There are all kinds of conditions of acceptance and conditions under which these circulars will be delivered.
I expect to issue new circulars on land for housing and industrial development shortly.
We have issued no separate circulars on after-school facilities.
